name: Grilled Chicken Salad
description: A healthy and protein-rich salad with grilled chicken breast, mixed greens, and vegetables.
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Add sliced chicken to salad and drizzle with dressing.
Toss gently and serve immediately.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
description: A colorful and nutritious bowl packed with quinoa, vegetables, and Mediterranean flavors.
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook in water for 15 minutes until fluffy.
Let quinoa cool to room temperature.
Dice tomatoes, cucumber, and bell pepper.
Thinly slice red onion.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa with vegetables.
Add olives and crumbled feta cheese.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and salt.
Pour dressing over quinoa bowl and toss gently.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving for best flavor.

name: Baked Salmon with Herbs
description: Tender baked salmon fillet seasoned with fresh herbs and lemon.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400째F (200째C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Pat salmon fillets dry and place on baking sheet.
Mince garlic and chop fresh herbs.
Mix olive oil, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Rub herb mixture over salmon fillets.
Slice lemon and place slices on top of salmon.
Bake for 15-18 minutes until salmon flakes easily.
Serve immediately with additional lemon wedges.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: A quick and colorful stir-fry loaded with fresh vegetables and a savory sauce.
instructions: Cut all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Mince garlic and ginger.
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add broccoli and bell peppers, stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add snap peas and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil, toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve immediately.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: A delicious and healthy parfait with Greek yogurt, berries, and granola.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix Greek yogurt with vanilla extract.
In a glass or bowl, layer half of the yogurt mixture.
Add half of the berries on top.
Sprinkle half of the granola over berries.
Repeat layers with remaining yogurt, berries, and granola.
Drizzle honey on top.
Garnish with chopped almonds.
Serve immediately or chill for up to 2 hours.

name: Lentil Soup
description: A hearty and nutritious soup packed with lentils, vegetables, and warming spices.
instructions: Rinse lentils and set aside.
Dice onion, carrots, and celery. Mince garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, and paprika. Cook for 1 minute.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes.
Remove bay leaf and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

name: Classic Caesar Salad
description: Crisp romaine lettuce with creamy Caesar dressing, parmesan cheese, and crunchy croutons.
instructions: Wash and thoroughly dry romaine lettuce.
Chop lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, toss lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Add lemon juice and anchovy paste, mix well.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
Top with croutons and freshly cracked black pepper.
Serve immediately for best texture.

name: Spinach Strawberry Salad
description: Fresh baby spinach with sweet strawberries, candied pecans, and poppy seed dressing.
instructions: Wash and dry baby spinach thoroughly.
Hull and slice strawberries.
Thinly slice red onion.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, strawberries, and red onion.
Crumble goat cheese over the salad.
Add candied pecans for crunch.
Drizzle with poppy seed dressing and balsamic vinegar.
Toss gently and serve immediately.

name: Italian Pasta Salad
description: Colorful pasta salad with fresh vegetables, mozzarella, and Italian herbs in a zesty dressing.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente.
Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking.
Halve cherry tomatoes and dice bell peppers.
Thinly slice red onion and chop fresh basil.
In a large bowl, combine cooled pasta with vegetables.
Add mozzarella balls, olives, and fresh basil.
Pour Italian dressing over salad and toss well.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Asian Sesame Noodle Salad
description: Fresh vegetables and noodles tossed in a flavorful sesame-ginger dressing with crunchy peanuts.
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package directions.
Drain and rinse with cold water, set aside.
Shred red cabbage and julienne carrots.
Slice snow peas and bell pepper into thin strips.
Chop green onions and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar.
Add minced ginger, garlic, and honey to dressing.
In a large bowl, combine noodles with all vegetables.
Pour dressing over salad and toss well.
Top with chopped peanuts and serve chilled.

name: Mediterranean Tabbouleh
description: Traditional Middle Eastern salad with bulgur wheat, parsley, tomatoes, and fresh herbs.
instructions: Pour boiling water over bulgur wheat in a large bowl.
Cover and let stand for 30 minutes until tender.
Fluff bulgur with a fork and let cool completely.
Finely chop parsley, mint, and green onions.
Dice tomatoes and remove excess liquid.
Add herbs, tomatoes, and green onions to bulgur.
In a small bowl, whisk lemon juice with olive oil.
Pour dressing over salad and mix thoroughly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Farro Vegetable Salad
description: Nutty farro grain combined with roasted vegetables and fresh herbs in a lemon vinaigrette.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425째F (220째C).
Cook farro in vegetable broth for 25-30 minutes until tender.
Drain and let cool to room temperature.
Dice zucchini, yellow squash, bell pepper, and red onion.
Toss vegetables with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast vegetables for 20-25 minutes until tender.
Halve cherry tomatoes and chop fresh herbs.
In a large bowl, combine cooled farro with roasted vegetables.
Add cherry tomatoes and fresh herbs.
Whisk remaining olive oil with lemon juice and minced garlic.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Let stand 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

name: Classic Waldorf Salad
description: Traditional fruit salad with crisp apples, grapes, celery, and walnuts in a creamy dressing.
instructions: Core and dice apples, leaving skin on for color.
Toss diced apples with lemon juice to prevent browning.
Halve grapes and dice celery into small pieces.
Roughly chop walnuts into bite-sized pieces.
In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, and honey.
Add salt to dressing and whisk until smooth.
In a large bowl, combine apples, grapes, celery, and walnuts.
Pour dressing over fruit mixture and toss gently.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
Serve on lettuce leaves or as a side dish.

name: Berry Quinoa Salad
description: Nutritious quinoa mixed with fresh berries, nuts, and a light honey-lime dressing.
instructions: Rinse quinoa thoroughly and cook in water for 15 minutes.
Fluff quinoa with a fork and let cool completely.
Hull and slice strawberries into bite-sized pieces.
Gently rinse blueberries and raspberries.
Toast sliced almonds in a dry pan for 2-3 minutes.
Finely chop fresh mint leaves.
In a small bowl, whisk lime juice, lime zest, and honey.
Slowly add olive oil while whisking to emulsify.
Add salt to dressing and mix well.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa with all berries.
Add toasted almonds and fresh mint.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
